safire.data.SAFIRE module¶

class safire.data.SAFIRE.DataDirLayout(name)[source]¶

Bases: object

A static class that holds constants that define the layout of a dataset root dir. For specific layouts, override the name attribute.

class safire.data.SAFIRE.MultimodalDatasetLoader(root, name, sentences=False, text_loader=<class 'safire.data.vtextcorpus.VTextCorpus'>, img_loader=<class 'safire.data.imagenetcorpus.ImagenetCorpus'>)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class that works as an interface for loading a SAFIRE dataset.

The loading itself may take a shortcut through a load class method:

>>> safire_multimodal_dataset = SAFIRE.load('/path/to/safire/root')
>>> mlp = MultilayerPerceptron.setup(data=safire_multimodal_dataset, ...)

Or the SAFIRE class may be instantiated:

>>> safire = SAFIRE('/path/to/safire/root')
>>> safire_multimodal_dataset = safire.load()

Relies on gensim-style corpora already being generated. If they are not present, will first need to generate them. Because that is a time-consuming procedure, the SAFIRE class will not generate them automatically. Instead, the following workflow is available:

>>> safire = SAFIRE('/path/to/safire/root')
>>> safire.has_corpora()
False
>>> dataset = safire.load()
ValueError: Corpora unavailable in SAFIRE dataset at /path/to/safire/root
>>> safire.generate_corpora(safire_root)
[...takes a long time..]
>>> safire.has_corpora()
True
>>> dataset = safire.load()
build_corpora()[source]¶

Creates all corpora necessary for the creation of the MultimodalDataset over the SAFIRE data.

has_corpora()[source]¶

Checks whether corpora for loading the SAFIRE multimodal dataset have been generated and are in the right place.

load()[source]¶

Creates the SAFIRE MultimodalDataset. If corpora are not generated, raises a ValueError.

Raises:ValueError
